Reviews.Title: “Avoid, there are better options”
Reviews.Author: boeingATL
Reviews.Content: There are MUCH better options in the area. While recently renovated, it feels old, run down and dirty. The general room lighting is headache inducing, dim. The front desk staff is rarely at the desk. View from the room. . . . miserable. Complementary HHonors breakfast. Where is the staff? Nobody to greet me, seat me. Finally, just sat down at a table. There was a high school girl's ball conference in town. They were loud, obnoxious and rude, as they ran around and visited. Their chaperones were engaged in their own conversation. Wait staff. . . invisible. Best recommendation. . . . gut this place and start over.

Reviews.Title: “A decent clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: Fazzone
Reviews.Content: A bit off the beaten path but convenient to downtown Dallas, this older property has refurbished and clean rooms and overall good service. While the old building creaks and groans at times, I found the hotel overall efficient and reasonable. AC units are marginal and noisy at least in my room. Construction next door awakens light sleepers at 6am. The restaurant serves good food. For a short business stay I recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “The Conference Adventure”
Reviews.Author: AsiaSue
Reviews.Content: The hotel lobby was inviting. The staff pleasant and courteous. Rooms were clean. The beds were extremely comfortable. The hotel staff went all out for our conference and provided a reception the first night. It is definately a hotel for business and pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay in on business”
Reviews.Author: Hugomorales33
Reviews.Content: Clean rooms, attentive service, friendly front desk personnel, good meeting facilities, good food.

Reviews.Title: “Dallas Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: Ann V
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for a family wedding. We returned from the wedding only to find out that our room was not cleaned. We had to call the front desk to get fresh towels. When we checked out I told the individual at the front desk that the room was not cleaned. He said - oh, well, despite that was your stay OK? I was like...that's it?? Heard from the General Manager when we returned home and he questioned the validity of my story and then blamed the incident on the fact that the hotel was booked. Not my problem if the hotel is completely booked - thought that was a good thing? Never heard back from them and would never return there again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean rooms recently & remodeled great location”
Reviews.Author: jfcdallas
Reviews.Content: Checkin was okay, nothing exceptional quick and efficient. The room was clean and just like my HHonors preference, I was away from the elevator. The price for the room was quite good, especially with the location of the hotel being about a 5-8 min. drive from downtown. I had a car so I didn't have to use the shuttle service, although I did see quite a few people waiting for the shuttle. Internet is free, so this was a plus for me and the room had individual temperature control which worked. The building is older, the ceiling is rather low on the tenth floor, but otherwise no complaints the lobby & hallways were clean and no noticeable offensive odors. The AAA rate was great in comparison to neighboring hotels. The beds were nice and clean and pillows were very soft, but not too uncomfortable. The bathroom was somewhat small, and it did not have an exhaust fan so mirror fogged up during shower but to be expected in older property. Although, I was surprised that the room had a microwave & refrigerator which allowed me to save money and store beverages :>) . Overall, for the value and location I would stay and recommend this facility to others.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean and comfortable rooms close to market.”
Reviews.Author: Tradewinns
Reviews.Content: The pros: affordable, clean and comfortable rooms. Nice, neat and clean lobby and other areas. The Cons: front desk check in was very slow, but friendly. The free shuttle does not go to Love Field airport, which is less than 5 miles away. Overall: I will definitely stay here again, it's a wonderfully affordable option and I've been to newer hotels that were not as clean.

Reviews.Title: “Nicely renovated older property”
Reviews.Author: Jlee73
Reviews.Content: Reading the other reviews, I was concerned. Upon arrival, I was pleasently surprised. Now you can tell that this is an older property, but you can tell that they have renovated and updated the rooms. I was on the 11th floor which is the Hilton Honors member floor. The bed is relatively new, nice and comfortable with no sags. Flat screen large televisions with microwave and mini frig. The only slight downside is the small bathroom. This is of course typical of older properties, but well maintained. And the value for the cost of the room compared to neighboring hotels is large. The rate is extremely lower, and I say worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place!!”
Reviews.Author: USA-in-Saudi
Reviews.Content: Came here for business and did not want to leave. Arrived on a cool, rainy night very tired from delays in flight and much turbulence. Was greeted with a hot cookie and friendly staff. Found a very clean and comfy room awaiting me. The next day I had a wonderful salmon sandwich which was unbelievably delicious!! The restaurant at this hotel is perfect, and the staff are very polite. I was able to use the shuttle several times to get where I needed to go. Would highly recommend this hotel and cannot wait to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Property”
Reviews.Author: travelnow39
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this property many times and plan on coming back. It is not the Anatole next door, but is consistently a good business traveler property for $139.00. Location is good to downtown and market district. Nothing within walking distance to property, including restaurants. Overall, staff has been very good and always very helpful. Property is older, but everything has been remodeled and very nice.

Reviews.Title: “True hospitality!”
Reviews.Author: amkmo3
Reviews.Content: I had prepaid reservations at the Sheraton Market Center and upon arrival I was informed my reservations were cancelled! (I still haven't received my refund to my credit card!) After a 9 hour drive I was exhausted, mad, and well the people at the front desk were rude and uncaring! I went across the street to the Hilton Double Tree and had the most wonderful experience possible! They had one room left and gave it to me at a discounted price with a roll-a-way bed because they didn't have a double room. They gave us cookies upon arrival and when we left. The staff here are wonderful, they have been trained and know what hospitality means. Thank you Ceasar, your kindness will not be forgotten.

Reviews.Title: “Very Poor Service”
Reviews.Author: vtstutz
Reviews.Content: Other reviewers have been spot on with their negative comments regarding the customer service provided, or should I say, not provided, at this particular hotel. The problems started from the get go when we were left stranded at the rail station. We were provided wrong information by the hotel's front desk regarding which station to go to when traveling from DFW on the Trinity Railway Express. Once we arrived at the correct station (Medical/Market Center) close to the hotel, thanks to advice from a fellow passenger on the train, we still had to wait 45 minutes for a shuttle even though the hotel is just a couple of minutes from the station. At the hotel, the less than astute front desk person could not figure out why she could not use my Hilton Honors Diamond Card as a credit card for incidental room charges. I kept telling her it was not a credit card. Zero acknowledgement of my being a Diamond member. Although the reservation was made more than 3 months in advance, with a request for a high floor, I was given a 3rd floor room. The room was very noisy, especially having to listen to the rope on the flagpole outside the room bang against the flag pole all night. The hotel advertises a complimentary shuttle for trips within a 3 mile radius. Did not happen. We were told we could not use the shuttle. Taxis are expensive in Dallas. Breakfast buffet has some options, but the buffet area is very small and usually very crowded. Not good when you have to wait upwards of 30 minutes for a table. After the first night, I filled out a comment card and left it for the General Manager. Over a month later I am still waiting for a response. The Hilton Anatole is next door. Would recommend staying there instead.

Reviews.Title: “Overall, not bad”
Reviews.Author: DeeDee134
Reviews.Content: On the positive side, there was lots of hot water, great water pressure, and lots of outlets. If you order the jumbo buttito, be prepared to share it or save half for another meal - they really are jumbo! On the negative side, the wifi connection and room lighting (for working/reading) were terrible, room service never got anything 100% right (although they were prompt), and the stuffed chair barely fit between the bed and window, so there was no room for an end table or place to put your drink.

Reviews.Title: “Needs Updating”
Reviews.Author: Pathfinder889
Reviews.Content: The person that did the check in was a trainee even though I was on the Hilton Honors check in line. He proceeded to give me the smallest room Non-smoking room available. When I got into my room, it smelled like there was a smoking party in there. I called and they said they would see what they could do and I waited over 20 minutes and I had to call them to see what the status was. Then they gave me an even smaller room...but at least it did not smell as bad. About 2 hours later, they called to let me know they had a larger room and apologized...guess that was when the manager found out I was a HH member. The rooms and bathrooms need to be updated even though they had a renovation here about 3 years ago. There was mold in the bathroom and the shower was leaking. They really need to fix everything properly. I am not going to stay at this location again. It is close to the Dallas Market Center if you are going....

Reviews.Title: “Solid Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jlee17
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on a business trip for 3 nights. I was pleasantly surprised by almost every aspect of the hotel. Despite a somewhat bland curbside appearance, the rooms are updated and clean and it has everything you need at a reasonable price. My room was $139/nt, which I assume was less than the Hilton Anatole just down the street. Ironing boards in room, free internet, marble baths, comfortable beds and linens. The exercise equipment in the fitness center was pretty new and certainly adequate to break a sweat after a day of meetings. They had aerobic machines and also some dumbbells with a bench. The bar and back porch were really great for team meetings and they were crowded every night I was there. The pool is outside and at the time the weather was too cool for my taste, but there were other who did use it. The restaurant and room service were good. Cabs in Dallas are expensive and I when learned that a DART station was a closeby, I used that a lot. It was a short walk but not an inviting stroll as you need to cross underneath a highway overpass. The hotel might offer a shuttle to the DART for downtown travelers who don't want to drop $20 on a 10 minute cab ride. A great restaurant nearby is The Moth - not much else otherwise.

Reviews.Title: “Review”
Reviews.Author: usaf10
Reviews.Content: Nice, clean and spacious rooms. Only complaint is that the pool was over run by kids. The room was nice though....two beds, a desk, internet, separate chair. Sheets seemed clean and the bed was nice. My mom and brother didn't really like the restaurant. I stuck with a salad and it was good.

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bug Potential”
Reviews.Author: kidrago329
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Doubletree 9/25 and 9/26 and just today woke up with bed bug bites everywhere. They say it takes 9 days for them to appear. Beware.

Reviews.Title: “Nasty Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sunrise100
Reviews.Content: Dirty Hotel,poor service,unintelligent staff knocking on my door at 1:30AM ??????? Had one meal at the hotel-poor service and food. Stay away!!

Reviews.Title: “Decent internet access, good hotel”
Reviews.Author: TomTX2000
Reviews.Content: Wireless internet access was decent, with the caveat that it was midweek after Labor Day and the parking lot was pretty empty (so little competition from other guests for using the internet) - still wasn't great internet access. "Wired" did not work. I've had better access in hotels, and had worse. My junior suite (free upgrade) was clean, neat, well-appointed with two large flatscreens. Good work desk with plenty of power outlets (lamp base and open wall outlets) with one problem - all of the outlets were so worn out that I had to keep fiddling with them to actually get power. Staff was great, checkin was stellar. Parking spaces are small and the parking lot is tight - fairly common for an in-city property. Enjoyed my dinner in the restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Your first thought will be: 'Get me out of here'!!”
Reviews.Author: TheAlcalde
Reviews.Content: If you are thinking this Doubletree is like all other Doubletree properties, you are gravely mistaken. If you like poor service, often highlighted by the unintelligent personnel, and you enjoy not having maid service, then, perhaps this is the place for you. I decided to stay here on a business trip to Dallas. Upon first impression, this property looks like a very old and run down building. Upon entering, my image was lowered as it was worse inside. There is no chocolate chip cookie. Literally. Worse, there is no one with any smarts working the front desk. I arrived and was greeted with a muted hello. After checking in I was not offered any help with my bags. This in spite of the porter being right by the elevator (he held the elevator door...) I called the front desk and got one of their very young and unintelligible staff. I asked if they have concierge service and was told "we don't serve french food here" (What???). I then educated the staff member and said they were people who helped guests make reservations at locales. I was immediately transferred to Hilton's online reservations. Clearly, I was not dealing with someone who even knew how to handle hotel guests let alone ever know what a conceirge actually does. The rooms are nothing exciting. They are small, old and crampy. The TVs are LGs, but there is no digital signal, only analog signals. What's the difference, you ask? Well, seeing how the USA has ruled no TVs should be running analog signals anymore, since 2009, you have to wonder. If that is not enough, once the TV turns on, your picture will flutter or look wobbly and scratchy. Even the movies you can rent look like videotaped ones. In the evening, the front desk called me a cab they said would "be here in 2 minutes". I waited for 30 minutes before I made them call the cab company again. Finally, after a 45 minute wait, the cab finally showed up. Not surprisingly, they told me the hotel had not called them until 15 minutes ago -- which meant they never called the first time. The internet is no better. In fact, when it breaks service, you will have to reboot your computer just to get it to work again -- even hard wired service is bad. Probably why it is free, here - they cannot get service anyway. On another occasion, I needed toothpaste and went to the (very tiny, crowded) gift shop in the lobby only to find that it closes at 2:00 pm every afternoon for two hours. Seriously, what hotel closes its ONLY store for 2 hours in the middle of the afternoon?? The manager, Fred, is no manager at all. Upon returning from a long day back to my room, at 3:00 p.m., imagine my surprise when my room had not been touched by housekeeping. I opened the door, looked up and down the hallway and saw no one still cleaning rooms. When I called to ask what happened, Fred says "they got til 4:30" to clean rooms. At that point, I was so upset I said forget it. Within minutes, all of a sudden there were two maids cleaning the rooms on both sides of mine. Gee, what a, um, coincidence. My experience here was so terrible, I had to get out of here. I saw out my window and the glimmer and shine of the Hilton Anatole was casting a shadow into my room. I told the manager I was not going to pay for that evening's room so I could leave and go to another one. His only reply was that i had to beat the maid or I would have to pay it. No "I'm sorry"; no "what can we do to help?" - nada. Just a warning to beat the maid. I knew I was making the right decision. Upon check out, no one said a word. No apologies, no questions, no effort. I did not accept their invite to call me a cab given the last time they "called one" it did not show up for almost an hour. I ended walking myself next door to the Hilton Anatole -- a REAL hotel with staff that have some idea of what they are doing. trust me folks, stay away from this Doubletree or you, too, will be saying "get me out of here!"

Reviews.Title: “I come here weekly for the clean rooms and the excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Magoo56
Reviews.Content: I am a regular traveler to Dallas; I stay at the Doubletree exclusively. The rooms have been re-done and are pretty plush, and VERY clean. The bed is great for a good night's sleep. The bar is very small and only stays open 'til midnight, but the entire staff is friendly and engaging. There's always a hot chocolate chip cookie, no matter how late you arrive. The exercise facilities are great, with plenty of PreCor exercise machines. The location is very convenient to downtown Dallas. Room service / bar menu are both great; I've not tried the restaurant. I strongly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay and good location”
Reviews.Author: keepmovin63
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night while attending a concert at The Meyerson, downtown. The rate was much lower than the downtown hotels and we were only a few minutes away. Travel between the Meyerson and Doubletree couldn't be easier. The hotel has been updated and is very clean and attractive. Staff were very welcoming and friendly, ready to do anything to make us comfortable and welcome. The bed was the best hotel bed we've had in a long time, with plenty of pillows to choose from. The room was extremely quiet. The one small complaint would be there were only two washcloths. There was a microwave, coffee maker, etc. - everything you need. It was a great stay, and we'll undoubtedly be back again and recommend it to friends. If the breakfast were included, our rating would have been "excellent."

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay near Market Center & Hospitals”
Reviews.Author: Jack2148
Reviews.Content: Had a few rooms here this week for me and my employees. Nice clean room, good bedding, nice pool, front desk very helpful. I would stay here for sure in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Doubletree”
Reviews.Author: TulsaLonghorn
Reviews.Content: I agree with the majority of reviewers: the hotel was clean, front desk was helpful, the rooms were comfortable and felt first-class. We got a room for $69/night through the hotel's web-site by selecting the pay-in-advance option. Great value ... we didn't feel that we sacrificed anything by paying a low price for a very good hotel room. They also take care of the little things at no extra charge: parking, wi-fi, cooklies when you arrive, apples at the front desk for the taking, a microwave & mini-fridge in the room. This will be our first choice next time we travel to Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “all smiles at the frontdesk”
Reviews.Author: ZIA H
Reviews.Content: frontdesk staff was amazing, all so nice. tammy, derek and the nice old gentleman driving the shuttle. the made my trip a pleasure. do..... go to the JFK memorial

Reviews.Title: “A decent place to stay”
Reviews.Author: cjc1977
Reviews.Content: This is a hotel built many years ago..I would have preferred a bigger bathroom..Overall the stay was reasonable..

Reviews.Title: “Doubletree Doesn't disappoint”
Reviews.Author: anansi22
Reviews.Content: Spent four days there for US Open Volleyball tournament. The team was sceptical but having stayed at multiple other hotela in the chain before I knew we were in great hands. Everything was excellent. The rooms spotless, restaurant great, bar was just what the doctor ordered after a long day. The staff was very accommodating and always with a smile. The shuttle service proved invaluable with the drivers going out of their way to help. The location is not close to many food choices but I found a gem right across the road - Bucks Prime barbecue. Owned by an asian family - very pleasant, great prices, tasty food. To frame this review, I was a 100% business traveller for two years and have stayed in countless hotels. Use this to judge whether you think I know a decent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Older Hotel”
Reviews.Author: 57Lulu
Reviews.Content: This is an older hotel. Rooms were OK but I could hear the man next door chatting on his phone all evening. The restaurant is terrible. Very slow service with servers who can't seem to get the request correct. Food is mediocre at best. Not many other options in the immediate vacinity though. There are a number of hotels in the area and I would try one of them next time.

Reviews.Title: “Nicely renovated with good amenities and an excellent gym.”
Reviews.Author: DCDoctor
Reviews.Content: There are numerous hotel options in the Market Center area. The location is a convenient drive to nice partS of Dallas, but the immediate area is not the best. The room was comfortable and well appointed. When I had a routine maintenance issue, it was resolved within five minutes. The gym is excellent and the breakfast buffet is equally nice. Very comfortable beds and the HVAC worked perfectly.

Reviews.Title: “This was the my first time staying at this hotel, everything was so wonderful I will never stay anywhere else but here”
Reviews.Author: jmartinez21
Reviews.Content: Frist time ever staying in the Doubletree hotel, from the moment we walked in to check in at the front desk everyone was so nice and helpful. Andy greeted us with a smile , and helped us find our all designation since we were not from around the area. Bar area was very relaxing and the food there was great.Anything we let them know we needed, we got fast and with no problem.House keeping was always great and very nice to all of us and helped keep our room very clean. The location was prefect right in the downtown area and i will strongly recommend this hotel to anyone that will be staying in Dallas. I will never stay anywhere else when visting Dallas, I have nothing bad to say about the Doubletree hotel !

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: mpiros
Reviews.Content: Travelled to Dallas recently to attend an art fair and film festival and was very happy with this property. The room was comfortable and all the staff were friendly and helpful. They also do a great Cobb Salad.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, good value, convenient location”
Reviews.Author: mghampton1744
Reviews.Content: Came to town for a friend's wedding. This hotel was convenient to the ceremony and reception location, Good deal on the price, and offered extras that many full service hotels in the Dallas area charge extra for (internet, parking). Room was great, clean and current, not dated, the staff was friendly. Overall a good stay.

Reviews.Title: “WOW...TRULY 1 OF THE BEST HOTEL'S IN DALLAS!”
Reviews.Author: USTRAVELER321420
Reviews.Content: We travel a lot and this is by far one of the best hotel we've stayed in. The hotel was immaculate. The staff was smiling and acted as if they truly loved their jobs and are really concerned about your stay. They are continuously checking to make sure you are happy and comfortable. The GM was walking around greeting everyone throughout the day. How many hotels have you stayed in where the General Manager is actually there to greet you and insure that your stay is above expectation as you head out the door? This the only hotel where I have had this experience. The rooms are beyond comfortable, the food is excellent, and the service incomparable. They also offer a free shuttle anywhere within 3 miles of the hotel. The hotel itself was about a mile from downtown Dallas but it can be a little stressful driving when we didn't know where to go so the shuttle was a great asset for sightseeing. I really can't say enough great things about this hotel, I don't just reccomend this hotel I highly recommend it and can honestly say I would not stay in any other hotel in the Dallas area. Sarina

Reviews.Title: “Average. Biggest issue is the musty odor.”
Reviews.Author: 190trav
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a few weeks recently. Not a bad property, recently renovated to the extent possible given it is an older building, so for example they can't change the low ceilings in the halls. The bathroom literally has room only for the sink, bathtub, toilet, and the door- you have to almost get in the tub to close the door. The thing that bothered me was between 3 different rooms over a few weeks, all had a musty odor. My clothes in my suitcase kept a slight odor after leaving.

Reviews.Title: “Good Experience”
Reviews.Author: imken504
Reviews.Content: I stayed 2 nights at Doubletree for a business trip. The location was great for me as it is close to downtown Dallas and easy to get to from the DFW airport. It is in my opinion a typical Doubletree Hotel, nothing really stands out but I don't have anything to complain about either. The room size was typical and the bed was comfortable. The food of the on-site restraurant was okay and reasonably priced. I would recommend this hotel if you are visiting Dallas and don't want to pay a premiun for staying at hotels in downtown.

Reviews.Title: “If I Could Choose Again I'd Choose Elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: quequedub
Reviews.Content: Too Many Little Things Went Wrong Pros: generally kind staff; passable and reasonably priced restaurant Cons: dated property; room was dark and depressing; poorly insulated against sound; very low water pressure; horrible showerhead; unuseful bathroom layout; There are multiple hotels in the Dallas Market Center area so I had my choice, not just of what hotel family, but of which Hilton property to stay at. I chose wrong. The Doubletree Market Center has the feel of a suburban hotel property: on a six lane street, near the freeway, with free parking, and not much to offer itself. I can't say that there was any one thing that was a deal-breaker but instead an accumulation of things. First, the room was very dark to the point that I needed a booklight to read a book at the desk. I would say that the room did not have a good flow but that understates the problem: its set up was such that no light could be reached from one side of the bed, there was no chair other than the desk chair, and the room was dark. Yes, I mentioned that already but it was a real issue. There was a sliding glass door that led out onto a balcony, which sounds nice but it was old and poorly insulated, so the wind whistled loudly through it and it rattled during the second half of my stay. The bathroom was large, which made me wonder why there only the bare minimum of counter space. I think the room was the handicap accessible room but there was still space for more counter room. The towel racks and all of that was across the room from the shower, unreachable if you'd forgotten to lay one on the floor before you got in (no racks outside the shower). The shower itself was perhaps the worst part of the room. The showerhead was detachable from the sliding mechanism from which it hung. The twist handle to keep the showerhead at a given length didn't work very well, so it was a test not to bump it. That was difficult because the showerhead would only rise enough that I (at six feet tall) had to hunch under it. Then there was the water pressure. Wait, no there wasn't, there was almost no water pressure. No matter the time of day I turned it on it didn't offer enough force. As for the common areas, they were okay and rather unremarkable, except for the hallway on my floor, which wasn't much taller than me, which led me to believe that perhaps it was a hotel for children. The bar area was nice and the restaurant was fine. I ate there and found the food to be passable and the staff quite attentive and kind. Generally, in fact, the staff were the high point of the stay. As for the surroundings, they are equally unexciting. There is a vacant, fenced lot next door that used to be a Holiday Inn; there's a Best Western on the other side; a Denny's is across the street. Otherwise, nothing is within walking distance, though, given the area, I wouldn't have walked anywhere anyway. Ordinarily I would have asked to be moved to another room but the hotel was 100% sold out, so that wasn't an option. After the first night my instincts told me to change hotels but I thought I'd tough it out. Should have gone with my instincts. Given the plethora of other lodging options in the area, do yourself a favor and consider another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great 3-Star Hotwire Hotel - Highly Recommended for Downtown Dallas"”
Reviews.Author: BSpeaker
Reviews.Content: Pros: - Very close to downtown - Very personable staff - A mile from American Airlines Arena - Free parking - Across the street from Denny's - Flat screen TVs with all the channels - Clean throughout - Outdoor pool - Very hot water w/ high water pressure - Plenty of space (two bed room) - Great hotwire rate ($44) - Doorman - Free cookie at checkin w/ fresh fruit at front desk - Restaurant - Free and fast internet connectivity - Free USA Today - Fast elevators that stay open on the ground floor for easy entry (major plus!) - Less than 2 miles from Kroger grocery store Cons: - No complimentary breakfast (Buffet for $12 per person) - No micro-fridge Overall: - Fantastic place to stay near downtown/central dallas with a hint of elegance

Reviews.Title: “Overall a Good Experience”
Reviews.Author: janderson27
Reviews.Content: Check in was a little slow, with no Honors express line, but the desk staff were very apologetic and friendly. The room service was excellent. Some of the best food I have ever had at a hotel. Very quick, and professional delivery staff. The rooms are clean, but a bit small as this is an older property that has been upgraded. Bathrooms are half the size of those at the Hilton Anatole accross the street. However, the staff make up for any facility short-comings with good service, a good attitude, EXCELLENT food, and the warm Doublletree cookies. A very good value. Enjoyed the free parking and no security concerns. Not the best area of town, but a short drive or taxi ride to many area dining destinations.

Reviews.Title: “excellent!very personable”
Reviews.Author: tiffanyamw
Reviews.Content: dec. 20-24, 2010 I usually prefer to stay at hotels that are 4 stars or above, but this place is amazing even though it's a 3 1/2 star hotel. it's literally like 2 minutes from the hilton anatole and a half or a third of the price! Parking is convenient and free. There are security guards driving around and monitoring the property which is a plus. thereâ€™s also a restaurant and convenient store across the street. Tammy, whoâ€™s super friendly, checked me in and gave me an excellent room, first impressions are important to me since I donâ€™t usually interact with any other staffs during my stay. thereâ€™s also a bar/restaurant, gym, and swimming pool on the property. I love my bed! itâ€™s so plush, super soft, and quiet!! Internet connections are free, even though, there was a power outage the second day of my stay, which interrupted my conference call, but it was quickly resolved. Overall I definitely recommend this place!!

Reviews.Title: “VERY EXPENSIVE STAY, WILL NEVER STAY HERE AGAIN”
Reviews.Author: pricetyh
Reviews.Content: My stay here was VERY EXPENSIVE; My SUV was broken into on Sunday Morning in broad daylight, one of five. The PUNK made off with my sons' PSP and a video camera, not to mention having the window smashed out and scratching and denting my door. My family and I will never stay here again. Doubletree/Hilton needs to invest into a video surveillance system and a better security team. No wonder they have a sign on the property stating that you take responsibility for parking on this property. I should have read the review from SET27 from purses1. Seems to be an ongoing thing here at this hotel, makes one wonder if it an inside job.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Stay! The Rooms are tiny...During my stay 5 cars were broken into. The security was sleep. Cameras dnt work!”
Reviews.Author: purses1
Reviews.Content: The rooms were very small... The parking was trouble. I will never stay here again. My truck was one of the ones that was broken into. This has very poor security at the rate that your paying.

Reviews.Title: “Ok, but older property”
Reviews.Author: Mugsydogg
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night because I usually stay in Hilton properties. Negatives- This hotel is an older hotel which is very obvious when you get to your floor. The ceiling are probably 6 feet and gives you a claustrophobic feeling. The room was smaller, and the bathroom one of the smallest I've been in, in a long time. VERY small. Also, only one elevator was in service. Pro's- comfortable bed, and nice TV/shampoo, etc,, general Hilton/Doubletree amenities (but don't accept Amex in the gift shop? weird) Overall the age of the hotel was a surprise for a Doubletree property and the size of the room was a shock. It wasn't a horrible experience and the hotel itself was really clean with a friendly staff, but I probably would try and find a "newer" style place.

Reviews.Title: “Suprisingly Nice”
Reviews.Author: klaskro
Reviews.Content: This hotel doesn't look like much from the outside, and indeed some things on the inside are dated (discombobulatingly low ceilings in the hallways for example). However, the staff is first-rate, it's clean, the pool is pretty, it's reasonable price-wise, and the breakfast buffet is very, very nice. Even the restaurant for dinner had pretty decent food (though it's ugly in that hotel-restaurant way). They were slow getting out my sandwich, but you know, the chef made it right by offering a free dessert. No complaints. Internet (wired and wrieless) OK, not perfect, but free at least.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed my stay”
Reviews.Author: mskekeb
Reviews.Content: Was there for the weekend and wished we were able to stay one more day! The service by the staff was excellent! The room was clean and the bed was so comfortable that it was hard to get out of it! The hotel was near many attractions and I look forward to staying there again. And by the way the cookies that they give you at check-in were delicious!!

Reviews.Title: “wonderful hotel for a great value”
Reviews.Author: pixeth
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I used Priceline's "Name Your Price" option and got the Doubletree for $40 or 50 a night I believe. The area in which the hotel is located is not the best but you're a very short drive away from downtown and all the fun spots! The access to the freeway ramps are also very easy and close. The parking lot was a little crowded but no big deal. The front desk was not as polite as I had expected from a Doubletree. I wouldn't say rude, but not very polite. Our room was wonderful! Big flat screen TV with good selection of channels, comfortable bed, clean bathroom with Neutrogena toiletries, and a nice view of the pool. I had no problem with the window seal letting in wind like some reviewers mentioned. Had a great stay at the Doubletree!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT STAY BUT READ WHAT YOUR RESERVING”
Reviews.Author: sah5173
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel for it consistency for comfort, cleanliness and it's convenient location, just minutes from Market, Cedar Springs, AA Reunion Center and downtown. I booked this time via Orbitz.com and after researching the different rooms, I found a special for one of the balcony room. With this reservation - I did not realize that the room that I had booked was a handicap accessible room, so some of the expectations that I have come accustomed to with their rooms were not in this room. The room had been recently renovated and they did not disappoint in the quality. One thing I will say is the views from the balcony were awesome ~ the negative is that this room has limited storage for clothes. Great for one or 2 nights but definitely not for many more than that!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel! Not the best area though! Be prepared to hear the wind!”
Reviews.Author: Pastor-TP
Reviews.Content: Overall, this was a great place to stay. The cookies at check-in are awesome! The staff, food, and room service are top notch. The rooms are large, clean, and very comfortable. Prices are also very reasonable to eat right on site! Be careful at night, the area is not the best. Also, the hotel itself is rather old. The windows do not seal well (especially our balcony door) which let a lot of noise and wind noise in at night. If you leave the A/C fan to on, this helps. Overall....we loved it! Great place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: oasyed
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel with my wife and two little kids after a long week of business. Great pool, friendly staff, comfortable beds, good variety at breakfast. The neighborhood is a bit ratty, but the hotel is safe and a good value.

Reviews.Title: “What a great find!”
Reviews.Author: mcz_travels
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this property last weekend. At the time of check-in until the time we checked out we had superb service. The room was nicely furnished and the bed was heavenly. I would definetly recommend staying here!

Reviews.Title: “Great place, great location, friendly employees”
Reviews.Author: McCabe18
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed here for a short business trip and would definitely recommend it to anyone traveling for business or leisure. The hotel was in the midst of a renovation and should only get better in the coming weeks and months. Everyone I ran into was friendly and helpful, the room was comfortable, the bed was spectacular, and I will definitely stay here if work brings me back to Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “Don't believe the reviews”
Reviews.Author: lblTampa_Florida
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel to be very clean and recently updated. While the area is not the best, if you need a place to stay in the area, the price I got on Hotwire can't be beat! Beds were comfy and the linens were nice. I suggest you stay away from the BBQ place across the street. My son got food poisoning from an undercooked hamburger. We ate in the hotel for breakfast and they had a nice buffet and the kids price was only $4.50. So even thought mine was $12, it was cheaper than eating at the Denny's across the street. Although the Denny's was good too. Do be sure to lock your rental as one was broken into while we were there and the alarm went off at 4am and we could hear it 9 floors up for over two hours! Overall, I would stat there again and probably will in Dec of 2012.

Reviews.Title: “Sketchy Location”
Reviews.Author: ViajeraSanClemente
Reviews.Content: We booked four nights here and moved after the second. The location does not seem to be safe and the area is seedy. We asked around and were told that since new lights were put up in the parking lot, the car break-ins weren't as bad....it's not an area you want to take a walk in. The rooms are OK, not great, with really small bathrooms, but the biggest problem is the road noise from the freeway. You will not sleep at night without earplugs. I concur with most of the reviews - nice staff, nice pool, cute little bar area, but these do not overcome the rest.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel -- left much to be desired”
Reviews.Author: chgotrvlr71
Reviews.Content: This hotel had ONE thing going for it -- the price. The rooms were a tad tired although the TVs were great. The hotel had ZERO information on local sites, no maps, no concierge, nothing. The staff tried to be helpful but didn't really have much knowledge. Free parking was nice, hotel is in a tad of a dicey neighborhood, lots of boarded up buildings, strip joints, pawn shops, nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Okay stay - full service hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rambotuba
Reviews.Content: This is a decent business class hotel. Everything you need is in the hotel, and is within driving distance of great restaurants and shopping. The neighborhood around theh otel is not sll that great, but is convenient to Love Field, medical canter, Trade Center, etc. Stayed here for a business conference. Facilities adequate, food adequate. Good breakfast buffet. Rooms very comfortable, bathrooms on the small side. Full bar downstairs and a nice clean poolside. Staff very helpful - good service.

Reviews.Title: “Never again!!”
Reviews.Author: jkbf
Reviews.Content: charged $150.00 for wine spill and we do not even drink!!! GUEST BEWARE . take pics of room before and after stay if you go here.

Reviews.Title: “NICE Place”
Reviews.Author: pat_davis
Reviews.Content: I had a wonderful stay, after my trek from Angels Camp visiting relatives, before heading back to Corpus. Thumbs up for a city hotel

Reviews.Title: “Okay ...not that great..Not recommended”
Reviews.Author: HoustonTravelmaniac
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for two nights, and have some serious complaints about the hotel itself. Good things ....a small full-service restaurant (with a nice, inexpensive breakfast buffet) and a pool that looked (I didn't actually use it) very nice. There were some problems with cleanliness & Air conditioner.The front desk staff were not very friendly. Not overtly rude.One of them was nice ...who showed me the places around there,very knowledgable ! The most significant downside to this hotel is its location &Air condition.immediately upon chck in I found 5-7 dead flying insects lying on the floor...I was lucky enough to get change of room upon request ! As hotel was only occupied one floor out of 12 ! When I visited Dallas,the outside temperature was 45-50 F,with 20-25 MPH wind.I put the thermostat on 90 F (First time ever in my life )...my wife was still feeling cold..inside room.I had to call 3 times...at frontdesk in order to fix that....That was terrible.If I could find something in a better locaton, I'd go for that....Not good for the amount they charge for !

Reviews.Title: “Okay Hotel, Not-so-great Location”
Reviews.Author: WynneWoody
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for two nights, and have no serious complaints about the hotel itself. It was a pretty typical Doubletree, with acceptable, clean rooms, a small full-service restaurant (with a nice, inexpensive breakfast buffet) and a pool that looked (I didn't actually use it) very nice. There were some problems with the elevators, and they had pieces of paper taped to the walls near the elevator doors, indicating that if you put more than 6 people on an elevator, it would get stuck. Sort of tacky, but I guess it's better than having people get stuck. The front desk staff were not very friendly. Not overtly rude, just indifferent, as if they could care less whether you were there or not. Not that I expect to be greeted with hugs and kisses when I check in, but a friendly smile and greeting are always nice. The most significant downside to this hotel is its location. The immediate area is not too bad (not too great, either), but a few blocks in just about any direction, and you begin to wonder if it's safe. I wouldn't be afraid to stay here again, but if I could find something in a better locaton, I'd probably take it.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice at a moderate price”
Reviews.Author: Grotshops
Reviews.Content: I've come to expect comfortable, clean rooms at Doubletree and this was no exception. The immediate neighborhood is a little "transitional", but we experienced no security concerns or problems. We didn't try the small hotel restaurant or bar - unless you're without a car, Dallas has far more appealing options. The small outdoor pool was very nice and has a deep end, which is increasngly unusual. This wouldn't be a good hotel for someone dependent on cabs or public transport. Depending on how good a rate I could get, I would consider staying here again, but the lack of free wireless internet service in the rooms is a minus.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!!!”
Reviews.Author: Auntie_MeMy
Reviews.Content: I read these reviews and just prepared myself for the worst. Everyone kept saying "shady area" and I guess shady is a relative word. It's not the best but I've seen shady and that area wasn't shady. My overall experience was FANTASTIC!!! From check-in to check-out, almost everyone was accommodating and friendly (only ran into one reception person with an attitude). I had problems the first night with the internet; couldn't connect after I had paid. When I went to the front desk after a couple of visits from the engineer, who couldn't correct the problem, the person at the desk had removed the charges and was apologizing for the inconvenience (he gave me a couple of extra cookies to boot). The room was clean and they kept it clean. The food was okay but that still does not sway me from my opinion of this place. I even enjoyed the gym. I would stay here again for sure!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Better than I originally thought..”
Reviews.Author: ez369
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nites at this property and initial thoughts going in was that this is going to be a dump. Once I checked in, I started having some good vibes. The front desk staff was friendly and accomodating the entire time I was there. The rooms have been recently renovated but they were a little small. There is a small bar on premise and it isn't cheap either. A premium vodka and tonic set me back $8.00 Kinda high considering the bar isn't anything fantastic and this wasn't even a super premium vodka. The breakfast buffett wasn't bad and I enjoyed that. Didn't try room service or ate at any other times in the restaurant. One of the things I did enjoy was free parking and it was quick getting from your car to your room. I'm so used to having to pay daily parking garage fees. The room probably had about 30 or so cable channels so that wasn't bad. Another positive is the close proximity to uptown, victory park, west end, love field, etc.. Although the immediate surrounding is kinda dumpy, it doesn't take long to get anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Service and cleanliness overcome the location”
Reviews.Author: Theguyfrom
Reviews.Content: I cannot say enough about the friendliness and can-do attitude of all the staff we encountered on a three night stay. Hats off to the bellman who drove me to the mall to find a jewelry store that was open on a Sunday - and waited for me to shop - Wow! The updates on the property are well in progress and I don't think it's fair for other guests to complain about a hotel's "architecture" as they had the opporunity to view the property prior to selecting it. The location could be better as indicated by oher reviews, but it is an excellent value and you will appreciate the efforts made by the staff to make your stay enjoyable. As a hotel operator I predict the reviews for his property will continue to to be favourable if they keep doing the things they are doing.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but location not great”
Reviews.Author: CATravelingGal
Reviews.Content: A group of us stayed at the Doubletree Market Center for the Texas-Oklahoma game the first weekend of October. I booked the rooms last December online with Hilton for a rate of $89 a night. As the game approached, rooms were as high as $229 a night. I am glad we booked early as the hotel is worth about $89 a night. The front desk staff was courteous at check-in. The hotel itself is clean and there were no major issues with the room - bathroom was clean and there was good water pressure. We used the shuttle service (3 mile service radius) to the WestEnd a few times and it was convenient. It saved taxis rides that averaged $25-35 for five people (Dallas charges a surcharge for extra people in a cab). A rental car would have been cheaper, but then we would have had to deal with parking in the WestEnd and at the state fair grounds for the football game. The Doubletree is not on the main drag of Market Center which is right off the freeway. It is off another street that is a bit dodgy. The other motels in the area were a bit run down. I know the hotel can not choose its neighbors, but it is unfortunate because the area brings the Doubletree down. We ate breakfast on Sunday morning in the hotel restaurant. We all ate from the buffet ($9.95) and it was a good deal. Omelet station, waffles, potatoes, eggs, meats, fruit, cereal, yogurt, juices, milk, coffee/tea provided. There is also a bar in the hotel that was a nice place to unwind after returning from the football game. Overall, the Doubletree was ok, but not great. If you can book it for a good rate (under $100) then it is fine for a stay. I think next year we will stay at one of the hotels directly off Stemmons Freeway.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Horrible Location”
Reviews.Author: MEB2010
Reviews.Content: Was here for a conference recently. The problem with this hotel is the location. Market Center is really not the center of anything. The hotel itself is nice, but there's no point in staying here as there's nothing around. The hotel offers a free shuttle service to the downtown area which helps, but otherwise it's about a 10-15$ cab ride. There are only two restaurants in the area - Denny's and Buck's Prime (which is actually a good spot for BBQ but they close early - around 8pm) and the Hawaii Spa which is dodgy to say the least. The hotel rooms are nice - standard fare. Didn't use the hotel restaurant or bar so cannot comment on that. The conference room was better than average but they had a cricket infestation which seemed to be a recurring problem. The pool area looked nice but I did not use it. If you are coming to this hotel, I'd reccommend renting a car.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff Great Guest Room”
Reviews.Author: SkiCountry
Reviews.Content: The front desk was excellent, they even went out of their way to assist me to the elevator with my extra luggage. The room was very large and comfortable, I had a corner room with windows on 2 sides which was nice. Every staff member I came in contact with was excellent. Great stay, will definitely recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but not quite up to the usual Doubletree standard”
Reviews.Author: Soda100
Reviews.Content: This hotel isn't as nice as other Doubletrees-- for one, the architecture reminds you of a government office building from the 60s, but it's perfectly fine inside. The showerhead wasn't well stuck to the wall so it would slide down, but hey, we still got a comfortable shower. The plumbing in the bathroom seemed to need some updating, too. The pool looked well-kept and inviting, though. The staff were perfectly nice and I saw them cleaning up an unfortunate set of dog-pooped shoeprints in the foyer that someone tracked in. Parking: Free and well-lit. Food: The restaurant breakfast looked perfectly nice, but the Denny's across the way is less expensive, though, of course, not as nice. Location: I have to agree with the earlier poster about the location: it's a little strangely placed in a big cluster of hotels. Surprisingly, then, there's not much in the way of restaurants or places to go for a walk around there. There's a divey-looking "massage parlour" across the street from this hotel that doesn't really invite you to go for a walk or hang out around the hotel's neighborhood. So I'd say this: it's a good location because you're a quick drive in to downtown Dallas and some of the cuter neighborhoods around Lemon Ave and Uptown. But forget it, if you just want to do much around this hotel, because all that's there is antique restoration studios (some quite nice, acutually, but it's all mixed up and kind of too far to walk around between) and more big hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Good Weekend Choice”
Reviews.Author: Tynkility
Reviews.Content: This is one of the big hotels downtown in the Market Center area. On the w/ends, the business people are away and hotel prices go way down. Unlike Los Angeles for instance, where downtown is a graveyard during the w/end, there are actually a lot of places open and things to do in Dallas. The hotel is right off the freeway, but a little funky to get to the first time. The location is central to both Love and DFW airports - 30min to each. As I've stated, there is plent of night life in the area, and all levels of shopping are within 10-30 minutes. My 2 night rate was $69@night for an immaculate room. The staff was friendly and supportive. The facility well kept and clean.

HotelInfo.Name: Doubletree by Hilton Dallas Market Center
HotelInfo.Address: 2015 Market Center Blvd, Dallas, TX 75207
